intro: Psychotria trifolia, commonly known as the "arrow poison vine," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers and dark green, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish berries that are often consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Psychotria trifolia contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. Its presence in rainforest ecosystems contributes to biodiversity and ecological balance.
